treatments.description: IV monoclonal antibodies that block PD‑1/PD‑L1 or CTLA‑4 to help T‑cells attack cancer.
treatments.duration: Infusion ~30–60 min; given every 3 or 6 weeks depending on drug/regimen; total course often 6–24 months or until progression.

The institute is equipped with cutting-edge medical technology including Gamma Knife for brain tumor surgery, Da Vinci Xi robotic surgery system, and MR LINAC for advanced cancer treatment.

FMRI operates with 330+ patient beds, 15 operating theaters, and 105 ICU beds, making it one of the largest healthcare facilities in the region. The hospital serves over 2 million patients annually and has a team of 200+ specialist doctors.

Key Highlights:
• First hospital in India to offer CAR T-Cell Therapy
• Advanced robotic surgery capabilities
• State-of-the-art cardiac care and transplant programs
• Comprehensive cancer treatment center
• 24/7 emergency services with specialized trauma care

FMRI is accredited by JCI, NABH, and NABL, ensuring the highest standards of patient care and safety. The hospital is strategically located 25 minutes from Indira Gandhi International Airport and is easily accessible via the HUDA City Center Metro Station.
